title: Effect of Single-Layer Graphene Substrate on Mitigating the Electron Beam Induced Damage in ZIF-8 Metal-Organic-Framework (MOF)
content: Characterizing materials at the atomic level is essential for understanding structure-property relationships at the nanometer scale. Typically, high-resolution scanning/transmission electron microscopy (HR-S/TEM) is employed for this purpose, utilizing high-energy electrons. However, when studying delicate soft matter, the use of an electron beam as a probe can be intrusive, potentially altering the original structure [1]. Therefore, it's important to investigate and comprehend how atomic-scale experiments affect the sample's structure. By controlling electron-sample interactions, including adjusting high tension, total electron dose, and electron dose rate, structural damage during experiments can be minimized [2, 3].
